website_summaries.verdict: A simple, no frills drive that offers 32GB of storage at a good price.
pros: Features a small size and fast transfer speeds at a low cost
The built-in slider cover protects the drive without the annoyance of having to keep track of a cap
cons: The slider can stick a little when you try to use it, requiring a little force to open it
Some users have reported problems with the drive becoming write-protected

customer_reviews.title: Cheap price but also quaility and support
customer_reviews.text: Had the 128gb version for about 7 months and used may be a dozen times and it failed with 0 capacity error that others have reported. there are no utility to recover the device like other manufacturers' websites. I feel cheated as I exercised care and other flash drives from other manufacturers are working fine. I'd stay away.
customer_reviews.author: Helen

customer_reviews.title: Excellent storage capacity for the price - but...
customer_reviews.text: I already had two PNY flash drives that have served well and lasted a long time, so I bought this one for its greater storage capacity. It works very well - and being a USB 3 drive, it's fast too when plugged into a USB 3 port. However, the clear plastic sliding shield on this flash drive "doesn't slide"! It's extremely difficult to get it to move. I literally have to use a pair of kitchen pliers to get it to move. That is totally unacceptable, so the protective cover has to stay open all the time - making it totally useless, which is so irksome, it cost it two stars in this review.
customer_reviews.author: A. Dobrynin

customer_reviews.title: Terrible plastic cover requires immense force to move back and forth
customer_reviews.text: So far it the drive hasn't died yet but the biggest gripe I have with this is the fact that the plastic covering is more trouble than it is worth. If you're looking for a USB drive with a cover, do NOT get this one. The cover is so cheap and hard to use because of how much pressure you have to apply to move the plastic cover over or away from the USB connector.
customer_reviews.author: Sobe

customer_reviews.title: Claims are false - horrible speeds
customer_reviews.text: PNY's claim that this is one of their fastest models is an absolute farce. If you're looking for real Class10 speeds, look elsewhere. I purchased this 128GB stick for a USB Record Crate for my DJ setup and constantly had issues with the speed of the memory. Go with a Samsung Bar Plus model if you want real speed. This thing is going in the trash.
customer_reviews.author: Chris D. Barton

customer_reviews.title: Nowhere near advertised speeds.
customer_reviews.text: This item was either a fake or if it is real has never performed anywhere near it's rated speeds. I have tried reformatting it several times to no avail. It looks like I'm not alone in this issue, so I am finally posting a review to save other shoppers the hassle.
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: Gets stuck
customer_reviews.text: It's a storage device, not much to say. BUT, I thought it came with a cover that comes off, but the cover slides up and down to expose the flashdrive, and it sticks when trying to cover it back up. I'm actually worried I'm going to break it at some point trying to slide the cover back on. With so many different storage devices, I would buy a different one. And I'll probably end up getting a different one myself, making this one a waste of money....
customer_reviews.author: Anne

customer_reviews.title: nice capacity but junk
customer_reviews.text: Got this for my fire cube and what a disappointment first day noting but issues very slow read and wright kept crashing and losing all my data i stored on it it made the device i connected it to run very clunky.I will not buy this brand again they have went down hill from years ago.
customer_reviews.author: Gerald Reed

customer_reviews.title: Don’t flash me!
customer_reviews.text: It was all that above but I had to copy a download for my Polk home theater and I thought I ruined the speakers. I had to call Support and she told me to try one with less Gb, it said to use 32Gb or smaller and since this one never been used yet I thought that was my best choice. I found an old SandDisk only 4 Gb and had to format it but it worked so I Don’t know if it was the size or the brand but it didn’t work for when I wanted to and it had me freaked out the whole day thinking I ruined my sound system.
customer_reviews.author: Dylan Gaige

customer_reviews.title: LOL; backup original drives install files BEFORE you format to NTFS
customer_reviews.text: LOL; backup original drives install files BEFORE you format to NTFS!! In a power outage I lost my WEB and could not use my drive; strangely JUST THIS DRIVE spent lots of time "Installing Drivers"... during the power failure I moved this to a standard HUB to add more connections. BAD MISTAKE!! "Installing Drivers" FAILED... All I wanted was to USE this "Mass-Storage" device and at no time should you need the WEB to do so!!! I had to remove the HUB {which just works with the older drives) and plug into the original port!! Dispite have that cute flashing transfer light using this new version is just a PAIN!! Don't BUY, just don't.
customer_reviews.author: Sober Poster

customer_reviews.title: Ridiculous Product
customer_reviews.text: I bought a 64GB drive that is only formatted for 32GB. To use the full capacity you have to reformat the drive to NTFS. Seriously? What do you have to feed people to be stupid enough to sell a 64GB drive that only has 32GB usable? Thus, knowing how poor the oversight is at this company for something as simple as the actual capacity, you can imagine just how poor the product is technically. Others have delved into the poor technical performance, so I'll leave it to their reviews. However, please do not get interested enough in a PNY product to even worry about its technical performance.
customer_reviews.author: S. Mcafee

customer_reviews.title: Slow like a snail
customer_reviews.text: Bought it more than 1 year ago. Not used often. The most significant impression is its slowness (although called USB3.0...). Using my Samsung USB3.0 64GB USB drive can achieve more than 100 or 1000 times faster than this snail. I didn't specifically compare then time. The fact is, copying a 2GB folder from Macbook to my Samsung USB3.0 takes less than 1 minute. And the same task would take forever for this one (manually stop copying it after more than 1 hour... Cannot tolerate its slowness feature). Attached picture just show its biggest feature --- slowness!
customer_reviews.author: Denyse

customer_reviews.title: Capacity dropped by 5 GB  from prior version
customer_reviews.text: I purchased one of these about a year ago or so: Capacity: 253,125,066,752 235 GB This one that arrived today: Capacity: 247,928,061,952 230 GB Same formatting on both. Why is the new one 5 GB smaller? Now it can't be used as an offsite backup for the older one because of the lesser capacity. Really lame. UPDATE- PNY tech support responded to my question. "Blah blah blah. It's in the FAQ. Blah blah blah. Actual capacity may vary. Blah blah blah. Continually making improvements that may impact capacity". It's sold as a 256 GB drive- it's 10% smaller than that. At what point is it *not* a 256 GB drive?
customer_reviews.author: C. Lira

customer_reviews.title: Too Slow to be Turbo
customer_reviews.text: This is suppose to be a fast, high capacity USB flash drive. It seems to have the rated capacity, 117GB plus the usual overhead, but it is very slow. It seems slower than a 2.0 USB with the same capacity. It stops and goes and stops until the average speed is too low to be considered turbo. UPDATE: COMPARED THE PNY TURBO 125GB 3.0 TO SANDISK 125GB 3.0. SAME 16,000 PHOTOS. PNY TOOK 4 HOURS TO COMPLETE 50%, SANDISK COMPLETED 100% IN 1 HOUR 5 MIN.
customer_reviews.author: PMbuyer

customer_reviews.title: tons of storage
customer_reviews.text: Bought the 256GB 3.0 thumb drive after misplacing my 128GB, and i've realized something. these PNY thumb drives hooked up into an externally powered USB hub, or my specific one (Anker 10 port usb3.0 hub (3 w/ smart charging ports)), it draws too much current/power, resulting in my wireless mouse receiver to stop functioning. I plugged a new SanDisk 128GB thumb drive into the same port, and my mouse still worked. as with the 128GB PNY thumb drive, i've had to plug it in to a separate usb hub that has my external drives plugged into instead. only reason it's getting the 4-star is the minor inconvenience.
customer_reviews.author: MBJ

customer_reviews.title: NOT 128gb anymore! Used to be, but now is 115gb!
customer_reviews.text: After discussing in detail with PNY, and they trying to convince me this was an error in manufacturing...which cannot be since the manufacturer installs the capacity of chip for that model, ie. 128gb and you would see about 125gb in Windows. NOW they have reduced this to 115gb only! I have replaced the drive 3 times and each one is the same 115gb. I have reported this to Amazon, opened a case with the BBB and reported it to Consumer Protection as it is maliciously being sold as 128gb with literally over 10gb less than you pay for! GET ANOTHER BRAND, you'll get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.author: Neurotico

customer_reviews.title: 256 GB initially, then 32 GB, or 7/8ths of capacity, thereafter!
customer_reviews.text: Giving one star, as this device was initially a superstar - obtained great read/write speeds (168 MB/s) in a USB 3.0 input. However, the device now only shows “31.9 GB” available, not the 256 GB (or even 236 GB) advertised and previously utilized! I’m wondering if 7 out of the 8 cells were fried/damaged, resulting in just 32 of 256 GB capacity? Either way, this device is NOT as advertised. Perhaps the heading should read, “256 GB drive for initial use, followed by 32 GB max capacity thereafter.” Explore other alternatives, as this device appears to be a repurposed SD/XD module that fails on initial use!
customer_reviews.author: J.M.

customer_reviews.title: Works great for downloading files off PS4
customer_reviews.text: This is absolutely perfect for downloading my screenshots and videos off my PS4! You have to have at least 250gb inorder for the PS4 to read the flash drive, so this works great. The only thing I had to do was modify it slightly...I had to remove the clear/gray plastic cover inorder for it to fit in the PS4 USB slot, but you'll run into that same issue with most other flash drives. It did everything I needed it to do, in a timely manner at that!
customer_reviews.author: Drew

customer_reviews.title: AVOID AT ALL COST!
customer_reviews.text: Tried to transfer one video over to it and got an error. Check and it showed video was on card. I tried to view the video and it wouldn't play so I tried to delete it. Flash drive is locked. I tried everything to unlock it and it did't work. The flash drive is unusable. I never even got to use it at all.
customer_reviews.author: amysnice

customer_reviews.title: Steal of a deal. Fast, fast fast
customer_reviews.text: I couldn't pass up the flash sale. It just so happens I needed something to put APK files on so I can program Android boxes much quicker. I downloaded the files onto my phone (Pocophone F1) connected the transfer module and all files seamlessly transferred on to this USB stick. Next was to make sure the files could transfer quickly on to the Android boxes I was programming. It was extremely fast process and the boxes read the USB stick no problem. I didn't need a lot of storage so I opted for the 32 gigabyte what I'm so impressed I will be purchasing a higher storage capacity this weekend.
customer_reviews.author: Alpha Wiring

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy - very hard to use
customer_reviews.text: I have always had PNY flash drives. Work great - attractive - easy to use - no issues! Would keep buying them! HOWEVER, they've changed the design. The new ones (PNY 32GB USB 3.0, Turbo Attache 3, etc.) are "impossible" to open and close. I bought 3 - opened 1 at a time. Pull - tug - tug - pull. Finally get it open and use it - seems to work fine, but absolutely can't get it closed... Try with the 2nd - same results. All 3 are defective. Ended up throwing them in my electronics recycling pile... Will never buy this product again.
customer_reviews.author: Barbara

customer_reviews.title: Good when they work?
customer_reviews.text: I purchased 3 of the 256GB drives to backup all my pictures. All formatted fine. First drive bricked itself in "read-only" mode in the middle of transfering pictures to the drive. Spent over 2 hours trying every trick in the book to force format, clear the read-only bit, and anything else I and the collective power of Google searches could think of before giving up. I doubt I even got 3GB loaded to it before it decided to die... Not a very happy camper, but my fault for not trying to load it up right when I got it. Will update if the other two drives last any longer when I try those.
customer_reviews.author: Morgan

customer_reviews.title: Did not work, showed as no media or 0 bytes on all machines
customer_reviews.text: Tried on windows 10 machine, removed drivers, went to asia website like they said and got their repair and it said it couldn't fix the drive. Tried it on another machine same problems. Driver is an SMI driver, could not get a newer one. Going to find a memory stick from a mfg that does their own drivers.
customer_reviews.author: Brett Maiwald

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality
customer_reviews.text: I bought two of these to use with my PS4. because of the outside case it is impossible to insert into the front of my PS4 I had to remove the sleeve that covers the USB connector to use it also on one of the units that I bought the sleeve does not slide open and close very easily I think they are very cheaply made. I tried to transfer an 8 GB video to a brand new flash drive and it told me I didn’t have enough room. I have read a lot of other reviews that they don’t last very long either. Look elsewhere!
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: You'll need a gorilla or a screwdriver.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased one of these and immediately returned it because it was 'defective'. Ordered another - same problem. The slider to protect the connector is manufactured wrong. The slider is EXTREMELY difficult to move. With both of these drives you would need a 500 pound gorilla to push the slide in or out. Not many people have a gorilla nearby (me neither) so I had to use a screwdriver to pry the slide back to the protected position. Rather than be a pain in the rear to Amazon I just keep the usb connector exposed.
customer_reviews.author: George R.

customer_reviews.title: Trusted Brand
customer_reviews.text: PNY is one of the best brands out there, excellent price. I am so glad I purchase one with more GB, I transferred videos to the 32gb and I couldn't believe how much GB I still have left. I highly recommend this product. My USB is my life I carry it everywhere, I can't wait to transfer my documents to the 256GB. (Purchase 2 of them)
customer_reviews.author: Rose

customer_reviews.title: Slower Than Molasses
customer_reviews.text: I generally prefer PNY to that other vendor who shall remain nameless (SanDisk). I like PNY SD cards and flash drives and my USB 3.0 64G drive is very fast. Unfortunately PNY seems to run out of gas when they exceed 64G. I have a 256 and this item, a 128. Both are incredibly slow in terms of read/write operations. Thinking that maybe it was an issue with my computer(s) I modified the drive so that I had a pair of 64G partitions. It made no difference. The drive is cheap enough so I am using it rather than returning it but I would not recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Altfather Good

customer_reviews.title: NOT very fast, don't bother
customer_reviews.text: I looked online and reviews said PNY drives were fast. they are not. this is a very slow drive. it's performance is very unimpressive. I guess the reviews I read were written by PNY employees. This is an example of having a bad product, telling lies about how great it is in the hope that people will buy it and not bother to return it when they find out that it is rubbish. I am returning the two i purchased. The behavior exhibited by PNY is not good enough.
customer_reviews.author: Derek R

customer_reviews.title: Too slow and has questionable quirks
customer_reviews.text: Maybe for some people this is useful, but if you are going to use this for a gaming system, dont count on it. The rw speed on this device is way too slow to handle wii u games, and i bet the case would be the same for other systems. On top of that, sometimes it crashes! This usb is maximum wack too when you are installing update data. The estimated time is going up and down and i swear the device is like taking a quick vacation before ALL OF A SUDDEN it goes from 10% to 40%. Dont buy this unless you are just using it to store pictures or something.
customer_reviews.author: Gramma Patty

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointing write speeds.
customer_reviews.text: There seem to be two types of thumb drives out there, ones that achieve their rated write speeds and ones that come nowhere close to it. I understand that some of the super cheap high capacity ones fall into this latter, group, and that's fine. I didn't expect an inexpensive, but priced in line with the market, drive from PNY to be in this group. I don't doubt some people will find it to be satisfactory, but I would not buy this drive a second time.
customer_reviews.author: npc

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working the third time I plugged it in
customer_reviews.text: I used to really like these flash drives. However, the most recent one I purchased was obviously different. Physically it felt cheaper. In the picture you can see the new one on the left. The new one has a matte texture while the old one is a has a glossy exterior. Obviously a different plastic was used and the notches that hold the sliding cover open and closed was much weaker. More importantly, it stopped working the third time I plugged it in. Became completely unresponsive. Files I had stored in it could not be accessed and would cause windows file manager to crash. Luckily I had nothing important stored on it.
customer_reviews.author: kawaiianninja

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely horrible performance.
customer_reviews.text: I am assuming I got a dud, but the speed of this flash drive is absolutely abysmal. In the order of low *K* bytes/second for serial writes. All write operations (creating/deleting files) positively sucked like a blackhole. Reading was also relatively terrible. I tested the drive on 3 different computers with the same results. Large file syncs of my programming data went from taking a few minutes to many hours. Since the reason I updated to a 64 GB was because my work no longer comfortable fits on the 32 GB drive I had, it's not particularly useful that it writes like a 1980's floppy diskette.
customer_reviews.author: Lawrence or Christine Dol

customer_reviews.title: The USB drive is initially formatted as FAT32
customer_reviews.text: LOL, it didn't occur to me to check the format until I tried to copy a bunch of videos larger than 4gb to the drive. Actually I was archiving 181 GB of photos and videos, so I set my archive process to work overnight, came back to a bunch of errors on each of the files over 4gb. So, I formatted to NTFS and started the archive again. Other than that, it functions well, is very speedy, and doesn't come with all sorts of bloat-ware on the drive.
customer_reviews.author: Marie Guerierri

customer_reviews.title: Happy customer
customer_reviews.text: I don't know how the tech support is really, because I've never had to use it. But I rated it 5 stars anyway because these PNY thumb drives are really neat. I bought these last two when they were the deal of the day, but I own about 3 or 4 previous generation PNY thumb drives, so this isn't my first rodeo with this brand. We're old friends. These are great. I don't need to go into detail about a thumb drive, since I'm sure everyone knows what they do, but the value is great and I've had no problems with data loss or anything of that sort with PNY.
customer_reviews.author: Am Azon Woman

customer_reviews.title: PNY Turbo 128 is a winner!
customer_reviews.text: No problems so far! What can go wrong with a flash drive, right? Well, plenty, as it turns out. I got hold of some bargain drives from a bid site, and all but one turned out to be bad. Stick with a brand you can depend on, like PNY, even if you pay a few dollars more. I like the built-in slide cover on this one, as you can't accidentally lose the cap. Drive seems quite fast on file transfers, although I admit I haven't benchmarked it.
customer_reviews.author: QuietType

customer_reviews.title: DEAD
customer_reviews.text: I dislike giving negative reviews but I used this one or two times, transferred all my music to a new computer, maybe my photos, out of 4 PNY thumb drives (8, 16, 64 & this 128g) this is the only one I have had fail. Dead as a doornail, probably out of warranty (1 year from PNY)..IDK..When I insert it into USB drive w my PC displayed it flashes an image of itself for a nanosec then it's gone. I can't view properties or reformat it if I can't find it, so I'm going to SanDisc for future purchases.
customer_reviews.author: LovinLife

customer_reviews.title: Good product by a well-known name
customer_reviews.text: I bought some thumb drives by some off brand name a while back and had trouble with them. I thought I'd stick with PNY as they are a good name in digital storage for many years. It was a very good price on a 32GB drive. Holds a ton of data with no glitches so far.
customer_reviews.author: Ol' Reg

customer_reviews.title: Not USB 3.0 speed.  SLOW!!
customer_reviews.text: This may be a USB 3.0 flash drive, but it is definitely not USB 3.0 speed. The transfer rate speed on this flash drive is terrible. And for those who are saying it's my PC, no it not. I have other USB 3.0 flash drive and they work great. Plus, I have a degree in Computer Science and work as an IT professional, so I might know a thing a two about computers. Anyways, this flash drive is faster than USB 1.0, but a slower than USB 2.0. If you are only looking for storage, this will do. But, if you're looking for media storage that will be used by a media player, this is not the drive for you.
customer_reviews.author: Phonesavanh Ly

customer_reviews.title: USB Stick Arrived Unusable
customer_reviews.text: I ordered the PNY Turbo 256GB USB3 memory stick to store some family photos and videos. Unfortunately, the product arrived broken. I plugged it into my computer & started copying one of my six files. The write failed in the middle of the copy of the first file. The drive then corrupted and says it is "write protected". After troubleshooting trying various tips and tricks, advanced drive formatting tools, Windows Command instructions, and registry edits, the drive is still not writable and is going in the garbage. Going to stay away from PNY products without doing more research in the future. This seems to be a common problem associated with bad sectors and corrupted file systems.
customer_reviews.author: Dave K

customer_reviews.title: Extremely slow write speeds
customer_reviews.text: At this point, I thought USB drives were commodity products that just worked. Not the case here. This has the slowest performance of any drive I have ever owned. It is absolutely maddening how long it to takes transfer files to this drive. I've used it on multiple pcs and devices, and the result is the same. Avoid this product.
customer_reviews.author: W.Cladley

customer_reviews.title: Wasted 4+ hours trying to fix it
customer_reviews.text: I spent 4+ hours with the drive and went over every step possible I moved the drive to other ports and went to device management and uninstalled and reinstalled several times I also went to disk management and updated drivers 3 times I also went and renamed the drive and relocated where it's supposed to go AND I even went and downloaded a pretty powerful software called mini tool to try and fix it and THAT didnt work this product is garbage dont buy it even if it's cheap like I did
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: and not a very good one.
customer_reviews.text: Lasted six months. The drive was fast, had a high capacity... and died quickly. It will not mount when plugged into USB 2 or 3 ports on an Asus laptop, a Lenovo desktop, a Mac mini, or an iMac. It will mount, sometimes, if plugged into a Anker USB 3 hub attached to a Mac mini. It will then dismount before everything on it can be copied off, and not mount again for several attempts, mount, and then dismount. It's a paperweight, and not a very good one.
customer_reviews.author: Charles P. Dyer

customer_reviews.title: Pretty fast download speed
customer_reviews.text: The Flash Drive is compact in size and files download fast on it even if your computer/laptop does not have USB 3.0 or greater. It is a little weird in opening the drive and I took a star off because of that but so far so good. I like this Flash drive and would buy it again. Have not used tech support so can't comment on it. Knock on wood I will never have to.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Does not last long
customer_reviews.text: It worked great for the first few weeks, then I began to see transfer speeds while writing to it slow down. When I would try to transfer files to it the transfer rate would be 60 mb/s then drop to 0 mb/s after a few seconds, then it would go back to 60 mb/s and back down again to 0 mb/s. The length of time it would remain at 0 mb/s got longer and longer until it's no longer worth trying to store anything on it.
customer_reviews.author: Oscar

customer_reviews.title: Literally the worst performing USB drive I've ever seen
customer_reviews.text: Random write speed is around 1kb/s. This is absolutely ridiculous. If you use it as a passive storage you'll be fine. If you try to do something more (actively work with the data or run some apps from it) it will be completely unusable. Update: PNY support was quick and professional. After some tests they offered me to replace this drive. Happy with support, still not happy with the item. Ended up just returning it.
customer_reviews.author: Valeriy Lashmanov

customer_reviews.title: Works fine for me, and fast
customer_reviews.text: I'm surprised other buyers have had so much trouble. My 128GB unit works without a hitch, with fast transfer speeds as well. I've used it with several computers and so far no issues at all with writability, readability, etc. I do take one star off because the thing is difficult to open and close. I've got to put it on a table and press down hard while I work the incredibly stiff slider. I do worry about breaking the plastic. So four stars. It does what it should for me.
customer_reviews.author: Robert J. Newell

customer_reviews.title: Good Quality
customer_reviews.text: Like all USB storage devices, this one formats to slightly less than the nominal capacity, depending on which format is chosen. Using NTFS format on my computer it has a storage capacity of 231 GB. I use it for storing a system image and for backup of my files. It has a built in activity LED light that flashes during read/write operations, which I like and it has a hole to allow attachment to a key chain or something similar. The sliding cover protects the USB connector when the device is not in use and is compatible with 2.0 and 3.0 USB ports.
customer_reviews.author: tom g

customer_reviews.title: 128gb USB plastic
customer_reviews.text: I use this product for homework assignments and to transfer files such as music videos. Until now it is working properly, it records and keeps file. However, it has a plastic cover that might break easily if not careful. The plastic covers the meyal portion of the usb that it is use to transfer files. Other than that..so far it is a good product and It has good (gbs).
customer_reviews.author: Cliente

customer_reviews.title: Faster than my USB 2.0 Patriot drive
customer_reviews.text: Out of the packaging, I tried copying a half-gig folder of digital pictures. I quit the process after about 20 minutes and almost no progress. Then I reformatted the PNY drive on my old iMac (USB 2.0 ports only) for "Mac OS Extended (Journaled)" and tried again, but with a smaller folder (157 MB). MUCH better results! PNY 128 - 01.28 Patriot 128 - 02:34 [and I KNEW from experience this was a doggie-dog of a slow drive!] Good enough for me.
customer_reviews.author: Larry A. Mitchel

customer_reviews.title: Avoid This Flash Drive
customer_reviews.text: Description reads 64GB at 3.0 speed. I received a 34GB and it is slower than any of my 2.0 drives. It actually pauses at 0.0/KB several times for several seconds. After reading other reviews I guess I should just be happy that it actually reads. I want to write nice things but I just can't in this case with this product. I do NOT recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Don

customer_reviews.title: Unbelievably SLOOOOOOW!
customer_reviews.text: I wanted a high capacity flash drive to play my music in the car. This thing has so many problems, I have to return it. First, it took 30 hours to transfer 100 gb of music from my server to the drive over my 1gb network. Then it refuses to eject from my Mac and at times it won't install. Do yourself a favor and avoid headaches and pick another drive. You'll be happy you did.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: USB3? No way! Abysmally slow transfer rate!
customer_reviews.text: It's got great storage for the price. I'll give it that, but I wanted - no NEEDED - USB 3.0 transfer rates. Write speed starts off at 36MB/sec, but if your file is large in size (else why get a 64GB drive?), then it quickly starts cycling down and back up again. Bottoming out at a paltry 2 MB/sec. Ridiculous! I've tested it side-by-side with other drives, with everything else being identical, and this PNY is the only one that has this cycling. Not worth the hassle of returning!
customer_reviews.author: Michael J. Stuart

customer_reviews.title: SAVED MY BACON
customer_reviews.text: MY COMPUTER KEPT CRASHING AND I HAD BEEN WANTING TO BACK UP MY COMPUTER JUST IN CASE....AND THEN THE COMPUTER FINAL CRASHED BIG TIME NO COMING BACK. AND THIS LITTLE GUY PUT ALL MY PICS FILES ETC BACK INTO MY LAPTOP AFTER IT WAS FIXED...WOOHOO
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very well made, like the slide decent 3.0 speed
customer_reviews.text: while this won't win any USB 3.0 speed tests, it is fast enough and does not get hot at all. I have noticed on flash drives that are really write real fast drives, tend to really run hot. I don't mind this one is a bit slower, since it does not get hot at all, it moved a 607mb video file in about 30-40 seconds, that's fast enough for me, specially since it was formatted in Fat32. For the price more than pleased with them.
customer_reviews.author: THXkid

customer_reviews.title: Can't to transfer multiple files.
customer_reviews.text: I got this because of the flash sale. I tried using this tonight, moving 22G worth of videos and photos from my phone. It wouldn't transfer multiple files at once. A message popped up saying there wasn't enough storage, which doesn't make sense... I thought maybe it was too many files at once so I tried to break up it into batches. Nope. I had to transfer every file one by one, which took a few minutes for each. After about a dozen photos I stopped. It was getting annoying and frustrating.
customer_reviews.author: aha

customer_reviews.title: Great capacity, super slow.
customer_reviews.text: Capacity is good, easy to use, design is nice. Slowest drive I have ever owned. I was transferring to this from a USB 2.0 external hdd and this drive was slower than the hdd. I tried on two different computers, one Win10 Pro and one Ubuntu, same results on both. After about three uses it started having errors and windows had to "fix" it a few times, but the data stayed intact. It's just so slow....
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: If you need it.... buy it!! Sturdy and good quality!
customer_reviews.text: Came quick and in really sturdy packaging. I needed it for something specific and it was exactly what I needed. It was a really well made sturdy little USB. I have purchased some at least twice the price from Staples and they were very flimsy and the reason I tried this one is because the last one I bought from Staples broke when I tried to insert it into my laptop! Will definitely buy this one again if and when I need another!
customer_reviews.author: amanda lynn champagne

customer_reviews.title: Lots of storage space.
customer_reviews.text: I was able to put a lot of home movies on this drive with no difficulty at all. It seemed to have plenty of storage space. I was able to take the movies to my brother's and plug it right into his (smart) tv. It worked great.
customer_reviews.author: Bet

customer_reviews.title: Fails very quickly
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because I wanted a more portable solution to move files in the 10GB to 20GB range. This failed during the first attempt to transfer files. Windows now says the drive has an error and needs to be repaired but no files can be removed or transferred to the drive. I have tried formatting the drive but formatting fails. Fortunately I did not have a lot of data on it yet because that would have made this more disappointing. I do NOT recommend buying this drive.
customer_reviews.author: Mat

customer_reviews.title: Fast and no problems
customer_reviews.text: I have a 16GB USB 2.0 PNY and this 32GB USB 3.0 PNY thumb drive. I have never had an issue with either and both perform at top speed for their respective capability. I can write a operating system ISO file (Windows or Linux) to the 32GB stick very quickly including any additional software or drivers to load. Installing an OS from the 32GB stick goes very fast when plugged into a USB 3.0 port. I’ve had the 16GB for years and the 32GB for a few months. No issues with either at any time. Would highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: David Pack

customer_reviews.title: Slide protective-cap is VERY tight, too tight for some to even use.
customer_reviews.text: I got this drive as I tend to loose the protective-caps from the ones with a removable caps. So a permanently mounted type seemed the solution. This drive has a slide-to-open protection sleeve. Great concept but it is far too tight. I had to use my teeth to slide it into the protection position, and when given to a friend, she had so much trouble with it that she broke the sleeve off entirely.
customer_reviews.author: Ed Davis

customer_reviews.title: An inexpensive 256Gb USB3 flash drive? Yes!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this PNY Turbo flash drive during Prime Day for under $50 (limit 1). If I could have bought more I would have. Flash drives are a commodity these days but this one is sturdy with a slide protective cover. I was able to transfer all of my music collection onto it for use in the car and still had room for photos and travel-related encrypted files. If you can ever find this at the same price, buy it!
customer_reviews.author: DaveInAustinTx

customer_reviews.title: Get What You Pay For
customer_reviews.text: I bought two of these last March. The first one died with a few months, the 2nd one just died on me and is corrupt. It seems like the more that you unplug and move around to different ports, the faster they break. DO NOT use these to store important files. It may be okay as just a portable stick to transfer files over, but I would not trust the longevity these. Also, the plastic sleeve that is supposed to cover the USB connector is trash. I am able to pull it back, but cannot push it forward any more to protect the contacts.
customer_reviews.author: Adrian Abeyta

customer_reviews.title: Works but don't get the speed others claim.
customer_reviews.text: I have the 32GB version and have the same issue as some of the reviewers with regards to write speeds. It gives a burst at around 100MB/s the first few seconds but then drops to around 20MB/s for the remaining time I'm writing to the drive (large files). Does that on more than 1 desktop/laptop with USB 3.0 ports which write accordingly to my 1TB external drive. Don't know if it's a defective unit or if it's just NOT as advertised. For the $10 I bought it I shouldn't complain cuz even a USB 2.0 drive would cost me the same amount in my country, but I'm just not convinced it has the USB 3.0 transfer speeds.
customer_reviews.author: Arvin Sajat

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY! SLOW AND IT STOPS WORKING!
customer_reviews.text: junk!! DO NOT BUY! I have so many USB drives but this is the worst! I put my movies on it and now they don't play! The slide open and close is stuck! Not worth a $1.00 very slow sending movies ,picture,music..ect. I've had it a couple months now. I had to transfer everything to a better USB drive. I'm telling you too save your money! Better ones out there.
customer_reviews.author: Eric L

customer_reviews.title: Should have read reviews about slow transfer speed
customer_reviews.text: It seems like it is a hit and miss with these units. I am currently transferring over 25GB onto a 64GB drive and I am on hour 5 and I still have 2 hours left. I know it is not my system as it is a brand new Mac Mini 2018 and I am transferring over USB3 that works well with other drives. It seems like some of these units work, but since this drive was for a family member, I cheaped out and bought a cheap drive. For my own personal use, I will not be buying PNY if this is what is expected. You get what you pay for...
customer_reviews.author: Danny Caudillo

customer_reviews.title: I should've read the reviews
customer_reviews.text: If you're seeing this you're already on the right track. I assumed it's a PNY thumb drive, I already have smaller capacity ones there's no need to read the reviews.... Boy was I dead wrong. This thing didn't work out the gate. Stuck it in my PC & it did nothing, but slow my computer down & not get recognized. This is sad, it's a pure garbage product.
customer_reviews.author: King Ramsey

customer_reviews.title: Great little USB
customer_reviews.text: I've had this for probably a year and have put it through some pretty unusual use. I carry this USB attached to a keychain holder on the back of my belt. This causes me to sit on it for most of the day. I have had the plastic around the keychain separate and the USB fall off a couple times. I would say that this is beyond what most people are going to put this USB through and it still works perfectly for me. The storage amount on it is great for keeping important documents on it, and it's size makes it very easy to carry around.
customer_reviews.author: Ian Briggs

customer_reviews.title: A very nice flash drive at a reasonable cost
customer_reviews.text: I bought the PNY 256GB Turbo Attaché 3 to use along with an automated sync program to maintain synchronized file folders on multiple PCs. It has worked extremely well for that purpose. It has plenty of capacity, it's fast, the build quality is good, and the price is very reasonable. Overall, it's a nice flash drive that works as expected.
customer_reviews.author: R. MCCOOL

customer_reviews.title: Failing within a month!
customer_reviews.text: I had been using a PNY thumb drive for a while, but the "protective cover" had become loose, so I bought this new one (larger capacity) to replace it. I thought it was strange it did not have the same "use" indicator light as the old model. However, I copied all of the data over and it seemed to be working okay, but yesterday it started failing ("USB not working correctly, scan the drive"). Very disappointed!
customer_reviews.author: T. Huse

customer_reviews.title: It works but wtf happened
customer_reviews.text: I have made it a bit of a ritual to buy one of these every quarter, for various projects and such. NEVER AGAIN! not sure and don't care about what exactly changed but, the drive I just opened is chintzy AF now it feels like something from Allied Express. Upside is it works, for now that is, but wait there's more bad news the protective slide is a MAJOR quality control failure, as it is stuck retracted and when I compared it to the previous drive I noticed that the grooves that work as tracks for the slide where NON-EXISTANT, and in effect the slide jams and is stuck open.
customer_reviews.author: depra

customer_reviews.title: Died right after copying files!
customer_reviews.text: I had to plug this in 3-4 times before the computer would read the drive. Then I quickly copied my files over. After I unplugged it, it cannot be read or even recognized on 5 different computers I've tried from trying to recover it. This cheap 64gb thumbdrive is going in the trash. No warranty support or information found on Amazon. Not worth the shipping to return.
customer_reviews.author: Dewey

customer_reviews.title: WRITE PROBLEMS - VERY SLOW
customer_reviews.text: I owned 4 of these in the past and they were all excellent, now I have tried 3 new ones in the past 30 days and when I try to write a file to them it will copy for 3 seconds, then stop for 10, then continue. Takes 1min 40sec to copy 2.5gb On my older PNY drive 256GB it takes 12sec to copy the same file. PNY says this is how they work now with less cache. DO NOT BUY
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Steve.

customer_reviews.title: No Problems so far
customer_reviews.text: Wanted a large thumb drive to provide extra backup. Got this one from Amazon warehouse for about 60% of cost of a new one. Looks & works like new, really no issues at all. (n.b. Just be aware that USB 3 never lives up to its hype. Even with a built in USB 3 port on my notebook, transfer rate is nowhere close to advertised.)
customer_reviews.author: David H

customer_reviews.title: Case slip is too tight, can damage plug
customer_reviews.text: I got a few of these and they all were badly made/designed... the case that slips back is so tight you have to force it hard to open and close, potentially damaging the plug. I will not buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Art

customer_reviews.title: So easy, tiny, I often just leave in my computer
customer_reviews.text: I feel like flash drives have become swag at conventions or from salespeople and out of all the ones I've gotten, this has become my go to. Capacity is great to hold most anything (outside of super hi-res video) and its been super easy to use, so much so that I often just leave it with my computer. I will let you know that did cause it to bend slightly (with jostling in my bag), but it still works perfectly!
customer_reviews.author: Joshua R

customer_reviews.title: Among the slowest USB 3 drives used
customer_reviews.text: Both of these 128 GB drives passed testing for counterfeit but the speed when copying very large files from a known good USB 3 port shows them to be insignificantly faster than an equivalent USB 2 drive. I'm very disappointed. On the other hand, they were not expensive and files transfer without error. But speed is two to three times slower than other USB 3 flash drives that I use.
customer_reviews.author: A. Figueroa

customer_reviews.title: I use this to image computers
customer_reviews.text: As a systems engineer I build many computers from AIX , ESX, Windows and various flavors of Linux. I use Rufus to lay out the bootable OS installation. This stick is fast and it only takes a couple of minutes to image the stick with Rufus and it's fast at laying out the OS installations (As long as you use a USB 3.0 Port)
customer_reviews.author: Paul E Bahre

customer_reviews.title: Good buy
customer_reviews.text: Works very well but for some reason the speed really varies. It will transfer very fast and drop to a stand still. It's still works just fine though. I've bought 3 so it's not that bad and all of my TV's read them just fine
customer_reviews.author: Ryan

customer_reviews.title: Slow speeds for big files
customer_reviews.text: Great storage for the price, super slow moving large volumes of files. Tried to use for transferring video files from my hard drive and after about 20 seconds it goes from 60 mbps to like 5 or less. Gata move one or two files at a time. Good for the cost but would be better suited for reading only purposes or for smaller files.
customer_reviews.author: 404UserNotFound

customer_reviews.title: Cute but be careful it can be lost very easily!
customer_reviews.text: This thing is really tiny! I've had it for a while now and I keep on misplacing it because it's so small. I'm Not absent-minded at all it's just that the thing keeps on slipping under something else. I suggest taping it to another larger object when you're not using it. Other than that I have no complaints whatsoever.
customer_reviews.author: WOWBUYS!

customer_reviews.title: Nowhere near USB 3.0 advertised speeds
customer_reviews.text: I must just be having bad luck with flash memory, but either I end up with obviously counterfeit products or in the case of this PNY drive, one that comes nowhere near the speeds others are reporting. The drive doesn't appear to be counterfeit, but I'm only getting 68MB/s seq. read and 30MB/s seq write. This is only marginally faster than my USB 2.0 drives and much slower than a USB 3.0 Mushkin 64GB drive I bought almost two years ago. Size is great, but it doesn't come near the USB 3.0 rated speeds on a USB 3.0 port. Especially compared to some of the older reviews here.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony M. King

customer_reviews.title: Dead/defective upon arrival
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointed with this device. I have never had problem with PNY in the past; but this particular device had problems out of the packaging. Files would not transfer, (multiple errors of "file not found" And then after properly ejecting the device and reinserting (to both a powered USB3 port and a USB2 port; received the Windows error "this device has errors" so I selected fix. After several re-occurrences the device gave up and the PC would not even recognize it. I don't consider the issue the sellers problem but PNY's. It has been subsequently returned in favor of 2 128GB units which I have had great performance from in the past.
customer_reviews.author: Dexter

customer_reviews.title: exFat formatted, NOT Fat 32!
customer_reviews.text: If you use 32-bit Windows XP, you will have to download the Microsoft Windows KB955704 ExFAT Updater file. Someone who calls himself "Greyghost" still has the 32-bit version on his web site. Without this file, you won't be able to format this USB drive. My greatest joy was this thumb drive did NOT come loaded with sofware programs on it to "help" us. The metal end also slides in and out of the housing very nicely.
customer_reviews.author: Gregory

customer_reviews.title: You're throwing money down the toilet
customer_reviews.text: I'm amending my review, now that the product has stopped working entirely. The transfer speeds went from a quarter of a 2.0 flash drive to 100 KB/s at the fastest, to not working at all. It's corrupted multiple files, I've done full formats 5 or 6 times, and the product just simply doesn't work. I should have listened to the other negative reviews, and I question whether or not the positive reviews are actually real or not. Save your money, buy a Sandisk Extreme or something, and it'll be faster and actually work.
customer_reviews.author: Ethan D.

customer_reviews.title: Slow Mo drive
customer_reviews.text: If don't mind waiting forever to transfer your data then it's OK. Differently not USB3
customer_reviews.author: Steve Gman

customer_reviews.title: Great for large storage
customer_reviews.text: My biggest issue is the slow transfer time. I might be my computer but none of my other USBs or External hard drives have this issue. When transferring large files particularly video files the transfer speed slows down to kbps. It start out well as mbps but quickly drops and stays down. A 5gb file took over a day to transfer.
customer_reviews.author: Ben Weed

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use. Portable
customer_reviews.text: I was just looking for a small thumb drive to install Windows with. This product is perfect for it. It say's it USB 3.0 so I just wanted the speed associated with that. It was very easy to format and the speed seems pretty fast. I like that the USB end can be covered while in storage. I would recommend this to others.
customer_reviews.author: Jules B

customer_reviews.title: Write speeds of 142 MB/s and read speeds of 159 MB/s for the 256GB model
customer_reviews.text: Not too bad, speeds are okay, given the price point it's still a good deal. I have a couple of the smaller 64 GB models and they don't reach nearly as high (54 MB/s write and 85 MB/s reads). The read/write speeds are a bit uneven, not sure why this is but some transfer sizes are abysmally slow.
customer_reviews.author: silverboi

customer_reviews.title: Flash drive
customer_reviews.text: I needed a small USB drive and this fit the bill. It is a little clumsy to use since the cover pushes forward to cover the plug in. When you attempt to plug it into the USB it slides forward and covers the plug. I quickly learned to push on the end of the drive not the sliding sleeve. Seems to work great.
customer_reviews.author: abuilder2

customer_reviews.title: Great Safetynet
customer_reviews.text: It works very easily--just plug-in drag and drop! The write speed isn't what you'd call fast but it's storing, holding and being able to bring things back is far more important than speed! I wanted something that would hold a good amount of data but would be smaller than an external hard drive. This is perfect!
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: Very good and function for the low price.
customer_reviews.text: It's a flash drive that costs almost nothing. I was able to utilize it as a BIOS update and Windows installation boot drive. It has an LED light for drive activity which is helpful to know the BIOS was doing its thing. I don't care how fast it is, if I did, I'd be buying a more expensive flash drive. No complaints.
customer_reviews.author: Mirrorsaw

customer_reviews.title: 128 gigabytes of pure awesome
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a device to backup my work computer with and this has more than enough memory to avoid a bulky external hard drive. I couldn't quite tell how the cap was affixed permanently, as it states in the description, when it seems like the translucent gray plastic would just pop off the top (not the case). The translucent part slides over towards the silver side and the flash drive connector is revealed. I attached a photo that shows the open-ended "cap." Update: with no files it says there are 119 gigabytes of memory (good enough for me) Also, it lights up red when you upload info on it, which is neat.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Murphy

customer_reviews.title: Look elsewhere
customer_reviews.text: Like others, I decided to give a chance. That was in September of 2019....and by the March it is barely usable. Granted I was able to use it to store files for that time it's basically useless now. Takes many minutes to mount on a computer and transfer speeds are in the "watch paint dry" realm.
customer_reviews.author: Mary C. Leibowitz

customer_reviews.title: NOT 128GB as marked
customer_reviews.text: I know this is an old purchase. But I just needed this drive's full capacity and my computer shows that even though the drive is marked 128, it's capacity is actually only 32! I've learned a lesson the hard way. I won't be trying to get the actual product I ordered it has been too long.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie

customer_reviews.title: Quit working after 6 weeks
customer_reviews.text: I bought two. A 64g and a 32g. The 32g quit working after 6 weeks. The 64 is working fine. I've been using PNY memory products for many years and this is the first bad product I've gotten so that is still a great track record for PNY. My PNY 256g has been working great for a long time and is still going strong.
customer_reviews.author: Michael R. Bradley

customer_reviews.title: Not good
customer_reviews.text: This is the first USB flash drive I have ever had that is soooooooo slow . It took forever to add files or very small ones . I got the spinning wheel of death almost every time . Then it would not eject ! I put in a different drive to make sure it wasn't my laptop and that drive worked as it should .Ugh
customer_reviews.author: Florence

customer_reviews.title: Where's the turbo?
customer_reviews.text: No turbo here. Don't know why, it just keeps slowing the transfer every time, and it's getting worse with every day. Can't return the unit cause I'm not from the USA. It's like something common I've seen in bigger drives. Terribly slow speeds no matter the brand you get or model. If you connect it to a usb 3.1 port it kind moves somewhat faster sometimes, but suddenly slows and hangs the transfer. No way to tell if I got a lemon, but I can't recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: THX

customer_reviews.title: Perfect!
customer_reviews.text: PNY brand name Fast shipping EASY to use- plugged into MacBook Air and dropped files I wanted to transfer to a different computer. Plugged into another Mac and downloaded the files in seconds. Much easier than the external hard drive I had used in the past. GREAT price!!
customer_reviews.author: LG19Gamer

customer_reviews.title: Still happy with PNY
customer_reviews.text: Had to give my original PNY 128gb to a friend, so I got a new one to replace it. Certainly cheaper than the original. Tons of storage, great price. Hanging from a lanyard on my wall right now. I have a few PNY SD cards, too. I've never had any problems with any of my PNY products.
customer_reviews.author: Scott A. Gardner

customer_reviews.title: A total fail!
customer_reviews.text: Judging by all the positive reviews I have to suspect that I got a flawed until. This stick is the SLOWEST USB drive I have ever encountered and it has crashed both my Mac and my Windows 7 computers. I used it primarily with my Mac and while I realized it was slow I did not immediately blame it for the sudden rash of hard crashes, but then when I plugged it into my Windows box and experienced the same thing I realized it was the culprit. Poor manufacturing? Substandard quality control? Who knows. I will be requesting a refund.
customer_reviews.author: Darrell St.Blaine

product_meta.title: PNY 32GB Turbo Attaché 3 USB 3.0 Flash Drive - (P-FD32GTBOP-GE)
product_meta.description: Size:32GBPNYs Turbo 3.0 is Built for Speed & Convenience Get the most out of the USB 3.0 port on your new computer. Experience USB 3.0 next generation speed performance with transfer speeds up to 10X faster than standard PNY USB 2.0 Flash Drives. It’s the perfect solution for easily storing and quickly transferring all your large documents, high-resolution photos, HD videos, and more. USB 3.0 offers the same ease-of-use and plug-and-play capabilities as previous generations of USB technologies, but with exceptional speed improvements. Designed for Reliable Portable Storage PNYs Turbo 3.0 USB Flash Drive is designed with convenience and portability in mind. The portable, light-weight Flash Drive incorporates a sliding collar cap less design that means for no more lost caps. This USB 3.0 Flash Drive is small in size, but big on performance.
feature_bullets: Transfer speeds approximately 10 times faster than standard PNY USB 2.0 Flash Drives
Store and transfer large files faster than ever with USB 3.0 technology
Allows for quick and easy transfer of all content
The 32GB Turbo USB 3.0 Flash Drive can hold approximately 5,632 songs
Sliding collar, capless design with integrated loop makes it easy to attach to key chains, backpacks and etc
Backwards compatible with USB 2.0 ports, so you can utilize any USB 2.0 or USB 3.0 port, compatible with most PC and Mac laptop and desktop computers

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.5 out of 5 stars16,525 ratings4.5 out of 5 stars
specifications.Best Sellers Rank: #51 in USB Flash Drives#1,775 in Computer Accessories & Peripherals
specifications.Domestic Shipping: Item can be shipped within U.S.
specifications.International Shipping: This item can be shipped to select countries outside of the U.S. Learn More
